text: I have a master's degree in mechanical engineering.

For the last 11 years, I have been
working for a small Ukrainian company
in furniture production.

Each and every business had been
shut down when the war had started.

Our lives changed completely.
I had to pack my whole family,
and move to a safer place.

I was driven by the desire of changes
and by responsibility for my family.
From first day of this war,
EPAM decided to help all Ukrainians in this situation.

ITSkills4U program from AWS, provides
free trainings and certification exams.
Graduates of ITSkills4U program including best of these graduates receives our job offer and start their contribution
on real projects in development team and it's start of their career.

ITSkills4U training helped me to
get a better understanding of how to build
robust and resilient solutions in the cloud.
It was an online course so I could learn and study from any location,
and this led me to the certification.

This certification benefited me in my
job interviews, so I got my job maybe because of it.

This program had a significant impact on my career
path because it helped me to gain the current role.

This gave me a confidence of my knowledge
in my day-to-day work because my project is highly related to AWS.
This year EPAM will celebrate 30th anniversary.

We are really proud to be a global
provider of digital transformation services.
We encourage our specialists to continuously improve their skills
in cloud from entry level specialists to high level specialists.

Now I'm working as a junior system
engineer to deliver developer's code
to AWS infrastructure, but I really hope my career will grow.

It's really important for Ukraine right now
to build a resilient infrastructure.
That's what we want for our customers to feel safe, for us to feel safe.
That's what Ukraine needs.
